revised_title: Classification and Analysis of Errant Annelides in Palaeozoic Rocks
tldr: The author examines and categorizes the obscure organic remains found in Palaeozoic rocks, particularly in Silurian strata of Britain, which are commonly known as "Fueoids," "Annelide-burrows," and "tracks." The author divides these remains into two groups: burrows of habitation and wandering tunnels, and surface-trails or "tracks." The author also describes some singular tracks produced by Crustaceans and proposes a new generic name for them.
